English:
(I can't see the client.)
(Maybe I've got the wrong place?)
Chinese:
（沒看見委託人……
　是搞錯地方了嗎？）
Korean:
(의뢰인의 모습이 보이지 않는 것 같다….
 장소를 착각한 걸까?)
German:
(Ich kann den Klienten nicht sehen.)
(Bin ich hier vielleicht falsch?)

English: Come one, come all! Step right up and take a look!
Chinese: 請來看看──！請來看看喔──！
Korean: 어서 오세요, 보고 가세요~!
German: Hereinspaziert! Kommt her und schaut euch das an!

English: Come and see!
Chinese: 請大家來看看～
Korean: 구경하고 가세요~
German: Seht nur her!

English: The Sistermon Sisters Training Gym is now open!
Chinese: 修女獸姊妹的訓練健身房開課中喔！
Korean: 시스터몬 자매의 트레이닝 체육관 개강 중이야!
German:
Das Trainingsstudio der Sistermon-Schwestern
ist jetzt geöffnet!

English:
And to mark the occasion, we have an amazing
special offer! We're giving away our Love Punch
absolutely free!
Chinese:
而且現在還有開課紀念特典！
豪華贈送我們修女獸姊妹的愛的鐵拳喔！
Korean:
지금이라면 체육관 개강 기념 특전까지!
우리들 시스터몬 자매로부터 사랑의 철권 대 서비스 중!
German:
Aus diesem Anlass haben wir ein fantastisches
Sonderangebot! Wir verteilen unseren Liebeshieb
gratis!

English: Come and feel our punch!
Chinese: 接下我們的拳頭吧──！
Korean: 우리들의 주먹, 받아보라구~!
German: Komm und spüre unseren Hieb!

English: Come and feeeel it.
Chinese: 請接下來吧～
Korean: 받아보세요~
German: Komm und spüüüre ihn.

English:
(Could they be the clients?
But they look like Digimon...)
Chinese:
（難道，那就是委託人？
　怎麼看都是數碼寶貝……）
Korean:
(설마 저게 의뢰인인가?
 아무리 봐도 디지몬 같은데…)
German:
(Ob das die Klienten sind?
Aber sie sehen wie Digimon aus ...)

English: Hey there! You interested in training?!
Chinese: 喔！　你一定對訓練很有興趣吧？
Korean: 아! 당신, 보아하니 트레이닝에 흥미 있구나?
German: Du da! Willst du trainieren?

English:
You look like you want us to really put you
through your paces! And is that a Digimon you've
got there?!
Chinese:
還長得一副請揍我的長相！
而且你有數碼寶貝耶！
Korean:
때려주세요라는 듯한 얼굴인걸!
게다가 당신, 디지몬을 가지고 있잖아!
German:
Du wirkst, als ob du auf Herz und Nieren
getestet werden möchtest! Und ist das ein
Digimon, das du da hast?

English: How about training your Digimon in our gym?!
Chinese:
怎麼樣？　要不要到我們的訓練健身房
來鍛鍊那些孩子啊！？
Korean:
어때? 우리 트레이닝 체육관에서
그 애들을 단련시키고 가지 않을래!?
German:
Wie wäre es, wenn du dein Digimon in
unserem Studio trainierst?!

English:
And we'll even double the power of our Love Punch
as a special offer!
Chinese:
現在的話，開課紀念特典的“愛之拳”
還能威力加倍喔！
Korean: 지금이라면 개강 기념 특전 "사랑의 주먹"도 두 배 위력으로 먹여줄게!
German:
Und als Sonderangebot verdoppeln wir die Wirkung
unseres Liebeshiebs!

English: Ah, you're the handyman we hired from Hudie.
Chinese:
喔，是募集幫手來的啊，
記得是叫便利店的……“hudie”吧？
Korean:
아아, 도우미 모집으로 온 사람이구나.
분명 해결사… "후디에"였었지
German:
Ach, du bist der Handyman von Hudie, 
den wir angeheuert haben.

English:
We didn't think anyone would accept a case from
Digimon, but there was no harm in trying.
Isn't that right, Blanc?
Chinese:
我還在想沒人會答應數碼寶貝的委託，
所以只是碰碰運氣試試看呢，對吧雪白？
Korean:
디지몬의 의뢰 따윈 아무도 안 받아주겠지 싶었는데
밑져야 본전이라도 해볼 만한걸~ 블랑
German:
Wir hatten nicht erwartet, dass ein Fall von
Digimon bearbeitet wird, aber ein Versuch
schadet ja nichts, oder, Blanc?

English: Right. Thank you for accepting our case.
Chinese:
就是說啊～姊姊。
那個～非常謝謝你，接下我們的委託。
Korean:
그러네요~ 언니.
저기~ 의뢰를 받아주셔서 정말 고마워요~
German:
Genau. Danke, dass du unseren Fall übernommen
hast.

English:
I'm Sistermon Noir. This is my younger sister,
Sistermon Blanc!
Chinese:
我是修女獸漆黑！
這是我妹妹，修女獸雪白！
EnglishCensored:
I'm Sistermon Ciel. This is my younger sister,
Sistermon Blanc!
Korean:
나는 시스터몬 느와르!
이쪽은 동생인 시스터몬 블랑이야!
German:
Ich bin Sistermon Ciel. Dies ist meine jüngere
Schwester, Sistermon Blanc.

English:
We're pretty well known in the Digital World, so
you should be honored to help us!
Chinese:
我們姊妹在數碼世界裡，算是小有名氣的
數碼寶貝喔，能幫我們可是你的光榮！
Korean:
우리 자매는 디지털 월드에서는 좀
유명한 디지몬이니까 도와줄 수 있다는 걸 영광으로 알아!
German:
In der Digitalen Welt sind wir ziemlich berühmt. 
Es ist also eine Ehre, dass du uns helfen darfst!

English:
You should explain everything first, or he won't
know what to do.
Chinese:
姊姊真是的，要是不先好好說明委託內容，
便利店先生會搞不清楚狀況，他會很困擾的喔～
Korean:
언니도 차암~ 일단은 의뢰에 대해 설명하지 않으면
해결사 씨가 무슨 일인지 몰라서 난처해 하잖아요~?
German:
Du sollest alles erst erklären, sonst weiß er
nicht, was er tun muss.

English: Oh, that's right!
Chinese: 喔，說得沒錯呢！
Korean: 아차, 그랬지!
German: Ach ja, richtig!

English: We only recently arrived in this world.
Chinese: 我們是最近才來到這世界的！
Korean: 우리들이 이 세계에 온 건 극히 최근의 일이야!
German: Wir sind erst seit Kurzem in dieser Welt.

English:
Gankoomon and his protégé Hackmon are traveling
around the Digital World on a quest to become the
most powerful Digimon of all.
Chinese: 我們是跟以最強為目標的數碼寶貝二人組──
Korean:
최강을 목표로 하는 디지몬인, 간쿠몬 사부와
그 제자인 헉몬――
German:
Gankoomon und sein Schützling Hackmon reisen durch
die Digitale Welt und versuchen, die mächtigsten
Digimon zu werden.

English:
We were traveling with them, but we got separated
and lost our way!
Chinese:
頑固獸師父和弟子的哈克獸一起，在數碼世界
進行修行之旅，卻跟他們分散、迷路了！
Korean:
그 둘과 함께 디지털 월드에서 무사수행 여행을 다니고 있었는데
떨어져서 길을 잃어버렸어!
German:
Wir waren mit ihnen unterwegs, aber wir haben sie
verloren und uns dann verlaufen!

English:
Yeah, and then we suddenly realized we were in
this world.
Chinese:
是的～之後一回神過來，
就只有我們來到這邊的世界了……
Korean:
네~ …그래서 정신을 차려보니 저희들만
이쪽 세계에 와 버려서…
German:
Ja und plötzlich wurde uns klar, dass wir in
dieser Welt waren.

English:
I wonder what they're doing now.
I hope Hackmon's training is going well.
Chinese:
唉……他們兩位，現在在做什麼呢～？
要是哈克獸有好好修行就好了～
Korean:
하아… 둘 다 지금쯤 어쩌고 있을까~?
헉몬이 제대로 수행하고 있으면 좋을 텐데~
German:
Ich frage mich, was sie gerade tun.
Ich hoffe, das Training von Hackmon läuft gut.

English:
Don't worry about them, Blanc!
We'll see them again soon. I can feel it!
Chinese:
沒事！　沒事的啦，雪白！
不用操心，之後就會遇到他們的啦！
雖然這只是直覺！
Korean:
괜찮아~! 괜찮아~! 블랑!
걱정하지 않아도 곧 만날 수 있어! 그냥 감이지만!
German:
Mach dir keine Sorgen um sie, Blanc!
Wir werden sie bald wiedersehen.
Das weiß ich einfach!

English:
Anyway, we're trying to find a way back to our
world.
Chinese: 總之就是這樣，我們在找能回到原本世界的方法。
Korean:
어쨌든 그런 이유로 
원래 세계로 돌아갈 방법이 없는지 찾고 있어
German:
Jedenfalls versuchen wir, einen Weg zurück in
unsere Welt zu finden.

English:
But it's taking ages. It's so dull and boring.
And we haven't got any money. We're going crazy.
Chinese:
但一直在尋找，所以很～～～～閒啊，
而且也沒有錢又無聊，總覺得很煩悶啊！
Korean:
하지만 그냥 찾아 다니기엔 너어~무나 심심하고 돈도 없고
따분하고 어쩐지 답답하거든!
German:
Aber es dauert so lange. Es ist so langweilig
und öde. Und wir haben kein Geld. Wir
werden wahnsinnig.

English: Noir, "dull" and "boring" mean the same thing.
Chinese: 姊姊真是的～閒跟無聊是一樣的喔～
EnglishCensored: Ciel, "dull" and "boring" mean the same thing.
Korean: 언니도 차암~ 심심과 따분은 같은 의미예요~
German:
Ciel, „langweilig“ und „öde“ haben die gleiche
Bedeutung.

English:
Whatever! There seem to be other Digimon in EDEN,
so we had the idea of opening a training gym!
Isn't that right, Blanc?
Chinese:
所以！　因為這EDEN也有數碼寶貝在，
所以才想開個訓練健身房！ 對吧，雪白？
Korean:
그래서! 이 EDEN에도 디지몬이 있는 것 같으니까
트레이닝 체육관을 열어보자는 생각이 든 거야!
그치, 블랑?
German:
Mir doch egal! In EDEN gibt es andere Digimon,
also dachten wir, wir eröffnen ein
Trainingsstudio. Nicht wahr, Blanc?

English: Yeah. Weak Digimon can come here to toughen up.
Chinese:
是的～
這是為了讓弱小數碼寶貝獲得力量，
來進行特訓的地方喔～
Korean:
네~
약한 디지몬이 힘을 얻기 위해 특훈하는 장소예요~
German: Ja. Schwache Digimon können hier stärker werden.

English: We're expecting our first customers any time now!
Chinese: 而現在，值得紀念的首位參加者就在這裡！
Korean: 곧 여기에 기념할 만한 첫 수강자가 올 거야!
German: Wir rechnen jederzeit mit dem ersten Kunden!

English: But there's one small problem.
Chinese: 可是……那有一個問題。
Korean: 하지만…… 거기에 한 가지 문제가 있어
German: Allerdings gibt es ein kleines Problem.

English: We know how strong we are, but we look too cute.
Chinese:
我們雖然對實力很有自信──
但外觀上，有點太可愛了吧？
Korean:
우리들은 실력에는 자신이 있지만――
애석하게도 생김새가 너무 귀엽잖아?
German:
Wir wissen, wie stark wir sind, aber wir sehen
zu niedlich aus.

English: We're not bragging or anything.
Chinese: 啊，你那是「居然自己說這種話啊」的表情～
Korean: 아, 자기가 말하지 말라는 얼굴이네요~
German: Das ist keine Angeberei.

English:
Potential customers might be put off when they see
how cute we are.
Chinese:
都是這可愛外貌害的，我們辛苦引來的客人，
搞不好還會瞧不起我們吧？
Korean:
이 귀여운 생김새 탓에 겨우 들어온 손님들이
우습게 볼지도 모르잖아?
German:
Potenzielle Kunden könnten abgeschreckt werden,
wenn sie sehen, wie niedlich wir sind.

English:
We thought it would be good if we had someone to
play the part of our scary lackey. That's why we
contacted you!
Chinese:
所以，我們才想到委託你們便利店
負責當“可怕的手下”！
Korean:
그래서 당신들 해결사가 무섭게 생긴 "부하역"을 맡아주면
좋겠다고 생각해서 이렇게 의뢰를 넣은 거야!
German:
Wir dachten, wir könnten jemanden gebrauchen, der
die Rolle unseres furchterregenden Helfers spielt.
Darum haben wir dich kontaktiert.

English:
A tough-looking lackey is sure to present an image
of strength to our customers.
Chinese:
作戰就取名為！　「有著可怕的手下，就能對
參加者製造出很強的印象大．作．戰～！！」
Korean:
이름하여!「우락부락한 부하를 거느려 수강자에게 강한 인상을
주자 대 작 전~!!!」
German:
Ein fies wirkender Helfer zeigt den Kunden, wie
stark wir sind.

English: That's the plan.
Chinese: 哇～直接把內容說出來了呢～
Korean: 와~ 이름 그대로네~요
German: Das ist zumindest der Plan.

English: But you don't actually look that tough.
Chinese:
……但是啊，
你的外表……還真沒有魄力啊。
Korean:
……그런데.
당신의 외모… 좀 박력이 부족하네~?
German: Allerdings wirkst du gar nicht so fies.

English:
Going by your reputation around EDEN, we expected
a huge man with biceps the size of watermelons.
Chinese:
聽說EDEN有很厲害的便利店時，
我還以為會是更凶狠的壯漢……
Korean:
EDEN에서 소문난 해결사라길래
틀림없이 우락부락한 거한이 올 줄 알았는데…
German:
Deinem Ruf in EDEN nach zu urteilen, hatten wir
mit einem großen Typen gerechnet, dessen
Bizeps so groß wie eine Wassermelone ist.

English: Right. But you look...normal. Unremarkable, even.
Chinese:
對啊～
硬要說的話很普通……也就是，大眾臉～？
Korean:
그렇네요~
굳이 말하자면 평범한…… 흔히 말하는 잔챙이 얼굴~?
German:
Genau. Aber du siehst ... so normal aus.
Unscheinbar sogar.

English:
What are our customers going to think when they
see you?! We have to do something about your look!
Chinese:
真是的！　你那種長相，
參加者不會覺得你很厲害啦！
快點去改變一下你的長相！
Korean:
정말! 그 얼굴로는 수강자들에게 강한 인상을 줄 수 없잖아!
지금 바로 그 외모를 어떻게든 해봐!
German:
Was sollen denn unsere Kunden denken, wenn sie
dich sehen?! Wir müssen etwas an deinem Aussehen
ändern!

English: It's not going to be easy.
Chinese: 姊姊，妳太亂來了～
Korean: 언니, 무리한 요구예요~
German: Das wird nicht einfach werden.

English:
But you're right. Can't you think of any ways to
make yourself look even a little scarier?
Chinese:
可是，也沒有錯呢～你能不能，
讓自己看起來再恐怖一點呢～？
Korean:
하지만, 그렇네요~ ……어떻게든 조금이라도
무섭게 보이는 모습이 되어줄 수 없나요~?
German:
Aber du hast recht. Hast du Ideen, wie du
etwas furchterregender wirken könntest?

English:
I could pull a scary face.
I've got a mask that could work.
Chinese:
試著擺出恐怖的表情
剛好有能派上用場的面具
Korean:
무서운 얼굴을 해볼게
마침 쓸만한 가면을 갖고 있어
German:
Ich könnte furchterregend dreinschauen.
Ich habe eine Maske, die helfen könnte.

English: Really? Show us.
Chinese:
哇～你做得到啊？
那就拜託你了～
Korean:
와~ 그런 게 가능한가요?
그럼 부탁 드려요~
German: Wirklich? Zeig mal.

English: Erm...
Chinese: 嗯～唔……
Korean: 아~ 그건……
German: Ähm ...

English: That's the least scary thing I've ever seen.
Chinese: 該不會，那就是……恐怖的表情吧？
Korean: 그게 무서운 얼굴……이라고 생각하는 건 아니겠지.
German:
Etwas weniger Furchterregendes habe ich noch nie
gesehen.

English:
We haven't got much time.
Haven't you got any other ideas?
Chinese:
我們也沒什麼時間了～
有沒有其他方法呢～？
Korean:
시간도 별로 없고~
다른 좋은 방법은 없을까요~?
German:
Wir haben nicht viel Zeit.
Hast du denn keine anderen Ideen?

English: Oh, you've got a mask?
Chinese: 咦，你說你有能派上用場的面具？
Korean: 아, 쓸만한 가면을 갖고 있다고?
German: Ach, du hast eine Maske?

English: Why didn't you say that to start with?!
Chinese: 那一開始就拿出來用啊！
Korean: 처음부터 그걸 꺼냈어야지!
German: Warum hast du das denn nicht gleich gesagt?!

English: Really?! Let us see!
Chinese:
咦，真的嗎！？
讓我看一下！
Korean:
앗, 정말!?
잠깐만 보여줘!
German: Wirklich?! Zeig sie mal her!

English: Oh! That's good!
Chinese: 喔喔！　很不錯嘛！
Korean: 오오! 그거 좋네!
German: Ach! Die ist gut!

English:
It makes you look scary yet subservient!
Just like you're our underling!
Chinese:
該說有種敵人的感覺呢，還是嘍囉的感覺呢！
就是滿滿敵方小角色的感覺啊！
Korean:
어떻게 봐도 악당스럽다고 할까 졸개스럽다고 할까!
잔챙이 같은 느낌이 팍팍 느껴져!
German:
Damit wirkst du furchterregend und unterwürfig!
Als ob du uns dienst!

English:
It makes me want to boss you around and beat you
if you disobey me!
Chinese:
就是想立刻變成無敵模式，
把你徹底打倒的感覺啊！
Korean: 당장이라도 무적 모드를 켜서 없애버리고 싶은 느낌!
German:
Wenn ich sie sehe, will ich dich herumkommandieren
und dich hauen, wenn du nicht auf mich hörst!

English: Sorry, my sister never thinks before speaking.
Chinese: 真是抱歉～姊姊太誠實了～
Korean: 죄송해요~ 언니가 솔직해서~
German:
Meine Schwester denkt leider nie nach, bevor sie
den Mund aufmacht.

English: But you'll make a great lackey with that mask.
Chinese:
不過，只要戴上那個面具，
你就能當個很稱職的手下了～
Korean:
하지만 그걸 써 주신다면
충분히 부하역을 부탁드릴 수 있겠네요~
German: Aber mit der Maske gibst du einen guten Helfer ab.

English: You're hired!
Chinese: 這份委託，就拜託你幫忙了～
Korean: 이번 의뢰 잘 부탁드릴게요~
German: Du bist eingestellt!

English: Come on!
German: Komm schon!

English: Ah, our customers!
Chinese: 啊，參加者來了！
Korean: 앗, 수강자가 도착했네!
German: Ah, unsere Kunden!

English: Get ready! Places, everyone!
Chinese: 快快快，準備了！　快點到位置上！
Korean: 자자, 준비해요! 빨리 자리로 가주세요!
German: Haltet euch bereit! Auf die Plätze!

English: Nokia, is this the training gym?
Chinese: 諾奇雅，這裡就是“訓練健身房”嗎？
Korean: 노키아~ 여기가 "트레이닝 체육관"이란 곳이야?
German: Nokia, ist dies das Trainingsstudio?

English: Yeah, and I heard the trainers are really famous!
Chinese: 對對對，而且還有知名的健身教練在喔！
Korean:
그래그래, 여하튼 엄청나게 유명한
체육관 트레이너가 있대!
German:
Ja. Und ich habe gehört, dass die Trainer hier
echt berühmt sind.

English:
Looks like there's a special offer? Maybe we'll
get something free? How exciting, Agumon, Gabumon!
Chinese:
而且開課好像還能拿到紀念特典喔？
會拿到什麼呢？
好令人期待喔，亞古獸、加布獸！
Korean:
개강 기념 특전도 준다던데? 뭘 주는 걸까?
기대되지, 아구몬, 파피몬!
German:
Hier gibt es ein Sonderangebot! Vielleicht
bekommen wir etwas gratis? Wie aufregend,
Agumon, Gabumon!

English: I hope it's food.
Chinese: 我想要吃的～
Korean: 난 먹을 거였으면 좋겠다~
German: Ich hoffe, wir bekommen was zu Essen.

English: Me too!
Chinese: 我也是我也是！
Korean: 나도 나도!
German: Ich auch!

English:
You two are so greedy.
You came here to train, not eat.
Chinese:
真是的，你們兩個都是愛吃鬼呢～
我們來這是要訓練的喔～
Korean:
정말~ 둘 다 먹보라니까~♥
여기엔 트레이닝을 하러 온 거래도~?
German:
Ihr zwei seid so gierig.
Man kommt zum Trainieren her, nicht zum Essen.

English:
What if another hacker attacked us and stole you?
You need to make yourselves powerful and strong!
Chinese:
……要是又被駭客襲擊，想搶走你們兩個的話，
那就頭痛了，所以要在這變得非常非常厲害喔！
Korean:
…또 해커가 습격해서 너희들을 뺏기기라도 하면
곤란하니까 여기서 무지막지하게 강해지자!
German:
Was, wenn ein anderer Hacker uns angreifen und
euch entführen würde? Ihr müsst mächtig
und stark werden!

English: Yeah!
Chinese: 嗯！
Korean: 응!
German: Jawohl!

English: Oh! Over there!
Chinese: 啊！　你看那個！！
Korean: 앗!  저길 봐봐!
German: Ah! Da drüben!

English: There you are! We've been expecting you!
Chinese: 來得好啊！　我等很久了！
Korean: 잘 왔다!  기다리고 있었다!
German: Da seid ihr ja! Wir haben auf euch gewartet!

English: Who are you?!
Chinese: 是……是誰！？
Korean: 누… 누구!?
German: Wer seid ihr?!

English:
Hehehe... Listen up.
They were born in the Digital World!
Chinese:
哼哼哼……既然你都問了，那我就報上名諱吧！
自遙遠之地，數碼世界而生！
Korean:
훗훗훗…… 묻는다고 답하는 것도 우습지만
태어난 곳은 머나먼 디지털 월드!
German:
Hehehe ... Hört zu.
Sie wurden in der Digitalen Welt geboren!

English:
Since they were born, it had been just the two
sisters against the world, yet they somehow
survived.
Chinese: 出生便為姊妹～，我倆相依為命～
Korean: 태어났을 때부터 자매 뿐~  간신히 연명하는 둘~
German:
Seit ihrer Geburt mussten es die zwei Schwestern
allein mit der ganzen Welt aufnehmen.
Aber irgendwie haben sie überlebt.

English:
Then one day, they met their savior:
Quake! Blast! Fire! Father! His name, Gankoomon!
Chinese:
那日與恩人相遇，地神（地震）！
神鳴（閃電）！神馳（火災）！父親！
名聲如雷頑固獸！
Korean:
어느 날 만난 은인은 지신! 신명! 신치! 친부!
그 이름도 유명한 간쿠몬!
German:
Eines Tages trafen sie dann ihren Retter:
Beben! Explosion! Knall! Vater! Sein Name:
Gankoomon!

English:
No longer alone on the streets, the sisters looked
up to him as a teacher.
Chinese: 於人生大路上迷惘的二人～，仰慕師父跟隨其行～
Korean: 거리를 헤메던 두 자매~ 사부를 우러르며 따른다~
German:
Sie waren jetzt draußen auf der Straße nicht mehr
allein und sahen zu ihm als Lehrer auf.

English:
Very soon, the sisters became highly skilled!
Their names were known far and wide!
Chinese: 姊妹定會修煉本事！　來日名聲天下知！
Korean: 어느덧 자매도 실력을 올려서! 이름을 널리 떨친다!
German:
Nach kurzer Zeit waren die Schwestern äußerst
geübt! Sie wurden berühmt!

English:
We are the Sistermon sisters!
We are the Sistermon sisters!
Chinese:
修女獸姊妹！　在此登場！
修女獸姊妹～　在此登場～
Korean:
시스터몬 자매! 여기 등장!
시스터몬 자매~ 여기 등장~
German:
Wir sind die Sistermon-Schwestern!
Wir sind die Sistermon-Schwestern!

English:
Welcome to our training gym, Nokia Shiramine,
Agumon, and Gabumon.
Chinese:
歡迎來到訓練健身房～
白峰諾奇雅小姐，以及亞古獸先生、加布獸先生～
Korean:
우리 트레이닝 체육관에 잘 왔어~
시라미네 노키아 씨, 그리고 아구몬 씨, 파피몬 씨~
German:
Willkommen in unserem Trainingsstudio, Nokia
Shiramine, Agumon und Gabumon.

English:
Today, the Sistermon sisters and our lackey here
will put you through a rigorous training program!
Chinese:
我們修女獸姊妹跟手下，
今天一整天會徹底鍛鍊你們的喔！
Korean:
우리 시스터몬 자매와 그 부하가 오늘 하루
너희들을 철저하게 단련시켜 주겠어!
German:
Heute werden die Sistermon-Schwestern und unser
Helfer hier euch einem rigorosen
Trainingsprogramm unterziehen!

English: Squee.
German: *Quietsch*.

English: Squee?
Chinese: 好？
Korean: 꺄?
German: *Quietsch*?

English: Squeeeeeeeeeeeee! The instructors are Digimon?!
Chinese:
好可愛喔喔喔喔喔喔～～～
道場的師父居然是數碼寶貝啊～～～！？
Korean:
꺄악귀여워어어어어어어어어어~~~♥
도장의 사범 대리는 디지몬이었구나~~~!?
German: *Quiiiiiiiiiiietsch*! Die Trainer sind Digimon?!

English:
I thought all Digimon looked like Agumon and
Gabumon, but there are so many types?!
Chinese:
我以為數碼寶貝都是像亞古獸、加布獸這樣的，
看來還有其他各種樣子呢──
Korean:
디지몬은 모두 아구몬이나 파피몬 같은 줄
알았는데 그 밖에도 여러 아이들이 있었구나~?
German:
Ich dachte, alle Digimon würden wie Agumon und
Gabumon aussehen, aber es gibt so viele Arten?!

English: You're adorable, but you don't look very tough.
Chinese: 但是太可愛了，不太有訓練的感覺呢──
Korean: 그런데 너무 귀여워서 뭔가 트레이닝이라는 느낌이 들지 않네~
German:
Ihr seid niedlich, aber ihr seht nicht besonders
fies aus.

English: Hmph. Our appearance is something of a curse.
Chinese: 嗯……這外觀果然罪孽深重啊。
Korean: 훗… 역시 이 귀여움은 범죄 수준이네.
German: Hmpf. Unser Aussehen ist ein Fluch.

English:
Don't underestimate us because of how we look!
Look at our scary lackey behind us!
Chinese:
但不要因為外觀太可愛就小看我們啊！
我們身後，可是有恐～怖的手下喔！
Korean:
우리들이 너무 프리티하다고 우습게 보지 않는 게 좋을걸!
뒤에는 무서~운 부하가 있으니까!
German:
Unterschätz uns nicht wegen unseres Aussehens!
Schau dir unseren furchterregenden Helfer
hinter uns an!

English: Lackey?
Chinese: 手下……？
Korean: 부하…?
German: Helfer?

English: Ah! That mask! Are you from the Demons?!
Chinese:
啊……啊啊啊啊啊！！！
那個面具！　難不成你是……惡魔亂舞的人！？
Korean:
아……아아아아아!!!
그 가면!! 혹시 너…… 데몬즈!?
German: Ach! Die Maske! Bist du von den Demons?!

English: What're the Demons?
Chinese: 惡魔亂舞是什麼？
Korean: 데몬즈가 뭔데?
German: Was sind die Demons?

English: A bad hacker team in EDEN!
Chinese: 就是EDEN的邪惡駭客隊伍！
Korean: EDEN에 있는 나쁜 해커팀이야!
German: Ein böses Hackerteam in EDEN!

English: Yeah, they do lots of bad things in EDEN!
Chinese: 對啊對啊，他們在EDEN做了一堆壞事喔！
Korean: 맞아맞아, EDEN에서 나쁜 짓을 잔뜩 하고 있어!
German: Ja, die machen viele böse Sachen in EDEN!

English:
Demons! Are you up to your tricks again?!
You won't get away with it!
Chinese:
可惡的惡魔亂舞！　在這也想做壞事嗎！？
我絕不放過你們！！
Korean:
데몬즈 놈! 이런 곳에서 간계를 꾸미는 거냐!?
용서 못~~해!!
German:
Demons! Führt ihr wieder etwas im Schilde?!
Das werden wir nicht zulassen!

English: Huh? What are you talking about?
Chinese: 咦？　咦？　等等，這是什麼情形？
Korean: 엥? 엥? 뭐야, 무슨 소리야?
German: Was? Wovon redest du?

English:
Don't tell me we're having problems on our first
day of business...
Chinese: 哎呀～開課後立刻就發生問題了嗎～？
Korean: 어라~ 개강 직후에 문제 발생인가요~?
German:
Jetzt sag nicht, dass wir gleich am ersten
Arbeitstag Probleme haben ...

English:
(Oh no! This misunderstanding could cause a lot of
trouble for the Sistermon!
I have to do something.)
Chinese:
（糟糕了……！　這樣被誤解的話，
　會對修女獸姊妹製造麻煩……！
　得想辦法應付過去……）
Korean:
(이런…!  이대로라면 오해를 사서
 시스터몬 자매를 곤란하게 만들겠어…!)
 어떻게든 얼버무려야 해…)
German:
(Oje! Dieses Missverständnis könnte Sistermon
wirklich Probleme machen!
Ich muss etwas unternehmen.)

English:
That's right. I'm all that's left of the Demons.
But I've turned over a new leaf.
I just collect masks now.
Chinese:
沒錯，我就是惡魔亂舞的殘黨
但是，我洗心革面了
……應該說，我只是個面具收集家啦
Korean:
그 말대로, 나는 데몬즈의 잔당이다
하지만 마음을 고쳐먹었습니다
…아니, 그냥 가면 콜렉터입니다
German:
Genau. Ich bin der letzte Demon.
Aber ich habe einen Neuanfang gewagt.
Ich sammle jetzt nur Masken.

English:
Just kidding.
That was a joke. Sorry.
I really do just collect masks.
Chinese:
開玩笑的啦……
我騙人的，對不起……
我其實只是個面具收集家……
Korean:
속았지롱……
거짓말입니다. 죄송해요……
사실은 그냥 가면 콜렉터입니다……
German:
Das habe ich nicht ernst gemeint.
Es war ein Scherz. Tut mir leid.
Ich sammle wirklich nur Masken.

English: What?!
Chinese: 什麼～嘛～！！
German: Was?!

English:
I can't believe it! It looks like this instructor
has a sense of humor, Agumon, Gabumon!
Chinese:
真是的，嚇死我了！
健身房的人不只特訓厲害，還很會開玩笑呢。
對吧，亞古獸、加布獸！
Korean:
아, 깜짝이야!
체육관에서는 특훈 뿐 아니라 농담도 가르치는구나
아구몬, 파피몬!
German:
Ich kann es nicht fassen! Dieser Trainer hat
anscheinend Humor, Agumon, Gabumon!

English: Yeah! Someone that funny can't be bad!
Chinese:
嗯嗯！
會開這種玩笑的人，一定不是壞人！
Korean:
응응!
저런 농담을 하는 사람이 나쁜 사람일 리가 없는걸~!
German: Ja! Jemand mit Humor kann nicht böse sein!

English: I think so too!
Chinese: 我也是這麼想的喔！
Korean: 나도 그렇게 생각해~!
German: Das glaube ich auch!

English: (I can't believe that worked.)
Chinese: （她們很單純真是太好了……）
Korean: (그들이 단순해서 다행이다…)
German:
(Ich kann nicht glauben, dass das funktioniert
hat.)

English: Turned over...
Chinese: 洗心……
Korean: 마음을…
German: Einen ...

English: a new...
Chinese: 革面……
Korean: 고쳐…
German: Neuanfang ...

English: leaf?
Chinese: 了嗎……？
Korean: 먹었다…?
German: gewagt?

English: I see!
Korean: 그렇구나~~~~!!
German: Ich verstehe!

English:
So you've given up your evil ways and now you're
making a fresh start? Good for you!
Chinese:
就是指金盆洗手，和壞人們斷絕關係對吧！
居然有駭客能做這種事啊……你好了不起喔！
Korean:
악행에서 손을 씻고 나쁜 동료와는 연을 끊었다는 거구나!
그런 것이 가능한 해커도 있었다니… 기특해, 너!
German:
Du hast jetzt die bösen Aktivitäten aufgegeben und
dich neu orientiert? Schön für dich!

English: I'm impressed!
Chinese: 嗯，我也覺得很了不起喔！
Korean: 응, 나도 정말 기특하다고 생각해!
German: Ich bin beeindruckt!

English: It can't have been easy for you!
Chinese: 這可不是簡單的事呢！
Korean: 아무나 할 수 없는 일이지!
German: Das war sicher nicht leicht für dich!

English: (I can't believe that worked.)
Chinese: （她們很單純真是太好了……）
Korean: (그들이 단순해서 다행이다…)
German:
(Ich kann nicht glauben, dass das funktioniert
hat.)

English: Just...
Chinese: 面具……
Korean: 가면……
German: Sammle ...

English: collect...
Chinese: 收集……
Korean: 콜렉……
German: nur ...

English: masks?
German: Masken?

English: Oh, I see!
German: Ach, ich verstehe!

English:
It's not my thing, but I never cease to be amazed
by the weird and wonderful hobbies people have!
Chinese:
雖然不太懂為什麼要收集那種東西，
但世界上的人還真是有各種興趣呢！
Korean:
어째서 그런 걸 모으는지는 잘 모르겠지만
이 세상에는 온갖 취미를 가진 사람이 있으니깐!
German:
Für mich ist das nichts, aber ich bin immer
wieder erstaunt, was Leute für seltsame und
wunderbare Hobbys haben!

English: Yeah! It's good to have lots of interests!
Chinese: 嗯！　有各種喜歡的東西，真有趣呢！
Korean: 응! 좋아하는 게 잔뜩 있다는 건 즐겁지!
German: Ja! Es ist gut, wenn man viele Interessen hat!

English: You shouldn't judge a book by its cover, Nokia!
Chinese: 這就是不能只用外表來判斷人吧，諾奇雅！
Korean: 겉보기로 사람을 판단하면 안되겠네, 노키아!
German:
Man sollte kein Buch nach seinem Einband
beurteilen, Nokia!

English: (I can't believe that worked.)
Chinese: （她們很單純真是太好了……）
Korean: (그들이 단순해서 다행이다…)
German:
(Ich kann nicht glauben, dass das funktioniert
hat.)

English:
In any case, I'm sure you're a good guy!
Sorry for getting you all wrong, masked man!
Chinese:
總之，你不是壞人！
對不起誤會你喔，面具人！
Korean:
어쨌든 넌 괜찮은 사람이라는 거네!
오해해서 미안해, 가면남!
German:
Ich bin mir jedenfalls sicher, dass du gut bist!
Tut mir leid, dass ich dich falsch eingeschätzt
habe, Maskenmann!

English: Sorry!
Chinese: 對不起喔～
Korean: 미안해~
German: Tut mir leid!

English:
I don't understand what just happened, but I guess
the misunderstanding's been cleared up now?
Chinese: 雖然搞不太懂，但就當作你們解開誤會了吧。
Korean:
사정은 잘 모르겠지만 오해가 풀렸다는 걸로
이해하면 될까?
German:
Ich verstehe nicht, was gerade passiert ist,
aber ich denke, das Missverständnis
wurde jetzt aufgeklärt?

English: Yeah. Now they're ready to start training.
Chinese:
是啊～
這樣子，就能安心接受訓練了喔～
Korean:
그렇네요~
이제 안심하고 트레이닝을 시켜드릴 수 있겠어요~
German: Ja, jetzt kann das Training beginnen.

English: Will training here really make us strong?
Chinese:
那個那個，我們在這訓練的話，
真的能夠變強嗎？
Korean:
저기저기, 여기서 트레이닝하면
우리들 정말 강해질 수 있는 거야?
German:
Werden wir durch das Training hier ganz stark
werden?

English:
Yeah, if you put in the work and stick with the
program right to the end.
Chinese:
是的。只要你們能好好～地，
訓練到最後……的話～
Korean:
네. 여러분들이 똑~바로 마지막까지
따라올 수 있다면…말이지만요~
German:
Ja, wenn ihr euch ins Zeug legt und bis zum Ende
durchhaltet.

English: We won't go easy on you! Are you sure about this?!
Chinese:
我們的訓練是很嚴格的喔！
做好心理準備了嗎！？
Korean:
우리들의 특훈은 혹독해!
각오는 되어있겠지!?
German:
Wir werden es euch nicht leicht machen!
Seid ihr euch sicher?

English: Wow! You're adorable, but so full of life!
Chinese:
嗚嗚……！　明、明明外觀很可愛，
卻好有氣勢……！
Korean: 우우…!  귀엽게 생겼지만 엄청난 기백…!
German: Wow! Ihr seid niedlich und so voller Leben!

English:
Although if we don't see this through, we'll be
weak forever!
Chinese: 可是，要是逃走的話，我就永遠這麼弱小……！
Korean: 하지만 여기서 도망치면 언제까지고 약한 채 그대로니까……!
German:
Wenn wir das allerdings nicht durchziehen, werden
wir für immer schwach sein!

English:
We're in your capable hands!
Put us through our paces!
Chinese:
就請您多多指教了，師傅！！
請把我們鍛鍊得心跳加速遍體鱗傷吧！
Korean:
잘 부탁드립니다 사부!! 저희들을
엉망진창 두근두근하게 단련시켜 주십쇼!
German:
Ihr habt das Sagen!
Bringt uns ins Schwitzen!

English: Please!
Chinese: 請您多多指教！
Korean: 주십쇼!
German: Bitte!

English:
That's the spirit! Let's get started, Blanc!
Lackey!
Chinese:
很好！我欣賞妳！
開始吧，雪白以及手下！
Korean:
참 훌륭한 마음가짐이도다!
시작하자, 블랑, 그리고 부하!
German:
Das ist die richtige Einstellung! Los geht’s,
Blanc! Helfer!

English:
Are you ready?
Okay, show us what you've got!
Chinese:
準備好了嗎～？
那就讓我們見識下實力吧～
Korean:
준비되셨나요~?
그러면 솜씨를 보겠습니~다
German:
Seid ihr bereit?
Gut, zeigt uns, was ihr draufhabt!
